content: Prior to the passage of SAFETEA, the most recent authorization for federal highway, highway safety, and transit programs was the Transportation Equity Act for the 21st Century (TEA-21). After October 1, 2003, federal surface transportation programs operated on short-term extension acts. Long-term reauthorizations, like TEA-21, are preferred for accommodating long-term planning and construction needs in the surface transportation community. Despite the consensus in the surface transportation community that long-term reauthorizations are preferred for planning and construction needs, short-term extensions have caused uncertainty in funding.
